name: AllergyIntoleranceProfile
title: AllergyIntolerance Profile
description: Proposed constraints and extensions on the AllergyIntolerance Resource

element.definition: The AllergyIntolerance Profile is based upon the core FHIR AllergyIntolerance Resource

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the codes refuted and entered-in-error that mark the AllergyIntolerance as not currently valid.
This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the codes refuted and entered-in-error that mark the AllergyIntolerance as not currently valid.

element.short: Code for allergy or intolerance status
element.definition: Code for an allergy or intolerance statement. Represents whether an allergy/intolerance is active or resolved (indicating no longer active).
element.comment: The binding strength of this element is [Preferred](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/terminologies.html#strength), meaning that codes are encouraged to draw from the AllergyIntoleranceStatusCode value set for interoperability purposes but are not required to do so to be considered conformant.

binding.description: Assertion about certainty associated with a propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance.

element.definition: Code for an allergy or intolerance statement. This may be a code for a substance or pharmaceutical product that is considered to be responsible for the adverse reaction risk, an allergy or intolerance condition.
element.comment: The binding strength of this element is [Required](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/terminologies.html#required), meaning that codes SHALL be taken from the specified value set to be conformant

binding.description: Assertion about certainty associated with a propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance.

constraint.human: AllergyIntolerance.verificationStatus SHALL be present if AllergyIntolerance.code represents NullFlavor concept

element.short: Code for absent or unknown allergy or intolerance
element.definition: Code for an allergy or intolerance statement (either a positive or a negated/excluded statement). This describes a categorical negated statement.
element.comment: The binding strength of this element is [Preferred](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/terminologies.html#strength), meaning that codes are encouraged to draw from the NullFlavor value set for interoperability purposes but are not required to do so to be considered conformant.

binding.description: Negation/exclusion codes for reporting no known allergies or not available data.

element.definition: Code for an allergy or intolerance statement. This may be a code for a substance or pharmaceutical product that is considered to be responsible for the adverse reaction risk, an allergy or intolerance condition.
element.comment: The binding strength of this element is [Example](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/terminologies.html#example), meaning that codes are not expected or even encouraged to draw from the specified value set to be conformant

binding.description: Type of the substance/product, allergy or intolerance condition.

element.short: Encounter when the allergy or intolerance was asserted
element.definition: The encounter when the allergy or intolerance was asserted.
Individual who recorded the record and takes responsibility for its content.

element.short: Source of the information about the allergy
element.definition: The source of the information about the allergy that is recorded.

element.short: Specific substance or pharmaceutical product considered to be responsible for event
Code for the specific non-drug allergen
element.definition: Code for the specific non-drug allergen or other agent/substance to which the Client has an allergic reaction.
element.comment: The binding strength of this element is [Preferred](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/terminologies.html#strength), meaning that codes are encouraged to draw from the NonDrugAllergenCode value set for interoperability purposes but are not required to do so to be considered conformant.

binding.description: Represents the specific non-drug allergen or other agent/substance to which the Client has an allergic reaction.

element.definition: The subset of codes with commonly used medicinal products that are available for prescribing and dispensing in Canada.
element.comment: The binding strength of this element is [Preferred](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/terminologies.html#strength), meaning that codes are encouraged to draw from the PrescriptionMedicinalProduct value set for interoperability purposes but are not required to do so to be considered conformant.

binding.description: Represents subset of codes with commonly used medicinal products that are available for prescribing and dispensing in Canada.

element.short: Specific substance or pharmaceutical product considered to be responsible for event
element.definition: Identification of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) considered to be responsible for the Adverse Reaction event.
element.comment: The binding strength of this element is [Example](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/terminologies.html#example), meaning that codes are not expected or even encouraged to draw from the specified value set to be conformant

binding.description: Codes defining the type of the substance (including pharmaceutical products).

element.short: How the subject was exposed to the substance
element.definition: Identification of the route by which the subject was exposed to the substance.
element.comment: The binding strength of this element is [Preferred](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/terminologies.html#strength), meaning that codes are encouraged to draw from the RouteOfAdministration value set for interoperability purposes but are not required to do so to be considered conformant.

binding.description: A coded concept describing the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto the body of a subject.
